snippet: A rescue attempt undertaken without prior notice to the countries whose citizens were taken hostage typifies Algeria’s independent approach, experts say.
abstract: Limits of Algeria's cooperation with United States to combat militants based in Mali are visible when Algerian forces storm gas facility where Islamic extremists were holding dozens of American and other foreign hostages, without consulting United States or other countries.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and MARK MAZZETTI

lead_paragraph: A rescue attempt undertaken without prior notice to the countries whose citizens were taken hostage typifies Algeria’s independent approach, experts say.

headline.seo: Limits of Algerian Cooperation Seen in Rescue Effort
headline.main: Lack of Warning on Rescue Effort Highlights Limits of Algerian Cooperation
headline.print_headline: Lack of Warning on Rescue Effort Highlights Limits of Algerian Cooperation
